gov.usgs.anss.edgemom

Class IndexChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • gov.usgs.anss.edgethread.EdgeThread
        • gov.usgs.anss.edgemom.IndexChecker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public final class IndexChecker
extends EdgeThread
    This class checks a series of IndexBlocks against a series of IndexCheckBLocks and sends requests to fill in any discrepancies to a EdgeBlockServer. This Thread is started by the Replicator class when a file is being replicated at the time the file is discovered. This class is not normally setup to run from a edgemom.setup. It is responsible for checking one file.
    The class also periodically forces full index file (.idx) fetches from the EdgeNodes

    Method : 1) On startup, each channel is scanned through all of the Index blocks from the beginning and IndexBlockUtil is used to check each block for being complete. If so, the block is marked as done in the bit set. If not, the bit is left unset for stage 2. 2) For each block marked as false on the blkset BitSet, the idxblock from the remote computer is compared to the IndexCheckBlock from the IndexFileWrite if it is the currently open one for this channel, or the check block is read from disk. If there are missing blocks, then requests are made and sent to the EdgeBlockClient to all of the remote nodes. The one with the data will eventually send the data and this test will show completed blocks.

    -dbg Run in debug mode.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IndexChecker

        public IndexChecker(java.lang.String argline,
                    java.lang.String tg,
                    IndexFileReplicator id,
                    Replicator rep)
        Creates a new instance of IndexChecker which checks the index blocks in one IndexFileReplicator against the check blocks and makes requests for missing data.
        Parameters:
        argline - The argline for passing the EdgeThead (only -dbg is used here).
        tg - The EdgeThread tag to use for output.
        id - The IndexFileReplicator object that is to be checked (basically links to the files).
        rep - The mother Replicator class this was started from, used to set the output print stream.

        public static void setBlockRequests(boolean t)
        Set the block Requests flag. Usually set by the main emptier of real time data when the queue is getting too full. This stops blocks from being requested when true.
        Parameters:
        t - The state to set the block Requests flag.

      • run

        public void run()
        Monitors the index blocks and the check blocks on the "replicator" end and looks for blocks that need to be resent. Since it is intimately connected to the indexBlock and checks block lists within IndexFile and IndexBlockCheck, it has to be run.
